title: Khalid Sheikh Mohammed
summary: Khalid Sheikh Mohammed (sometimes also spelled Shaikh;[4] also known by at least 50 pseudonyms;[5] born March 1, 1964, or April 14, 1965) is a Pakistani Islamist militant held by the United States at the Guantanamo Bay detention camp under terrorism-related charges. He was named as "the principal architect of the 9/11 attacks" in the 9/11 Commission Report.[6]
